channel.title: I dare you to answer this!
channel.description:
Hi when i go into my server source and click runserver.bat the screen pops up then closes right away! the message says this
"Java Cannot be Recognized as an External command" i have java version 6 update 12 and what are the enviroment variables suppose to be
Please help!!!! :mad:

item.title: I dare you to answer this!
item.dc:creator: @lmfaoown lmfaoown
item.description:
@lmfaoown wrote:

this man is really lazy…

instructions… (i put it in bold so you can read with your puny mind)

[b]GO TO "C: -> PROGRAM FILES -> JAVA.

Check which JDK YOU HAVE. Mine is jdk1.6.0_10.

check your RUN.BAT or RUN.CMD and CHANGE IT.

GRATZ![/b]

good boy!

Read full topic

@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“XXwolfXX, post:12, topic:261712”]i have ran a server before on my sisters computer… but somebody told me there path variable and i copied and pasted then i was good to go![/quote]Then follow Soul’s tutorial on how to set up a server. If it’s not your JDK version in your compiler, it’s your environmental variables.

item.source: I dare you to answer this!

item.title: I dare you to answer this!
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

You go in your source folder, and right click your compiler.bat. Select “edit” so that a notepad pops up containing your compiler information. It should show a version of JDK in there. All you have to do is edit the JDK version in that notepad to whatever JDK version you have downloaded. There’s not a better way to explain it unless you want popup pictures.

Read full topic

@The_Reaper_X wrote:
